Author: staunch
Content: I do think that's a simplistic, but accurate, description of many successful startups.

Author: corentin
Content:
Right; they only have a few thousands of improvised fighters ready to sacrifice themselves for an idea. Yet, they usually beat the shit out of huge, well-trained and well-equipped armies.

In most PG essays, replace the words "startups" by "guerrilleros" and "corporations" by "armies" and most of the ideas he defends still stand.

Author: pramodbiligiri
Content: Not as much as I used to. programming.reddit and news.yc have replaced it almost entirely. Whenever I check Slashdot nowadays I feel the stories are too political and trollish. Is it just me or has the comments quality on Slashdot actually declined significantly in the last year or so?
